questions.question_text:
Fill in the Blank.
Which CLI command you use in WLC to update the running IOS?

discussion.content:
This question is very vague. 
It could also be asking how to change between primary / backup image. In that case it would be "Config boot [Primary /Backup]"

(Cisco Controller) >config boot ?
 
primary Sets the primary image as active.
backup Sets the backup image as active.

Not sure where this question is going.

To change between the primary and backup images on a WLC, the command from CLI is:

"config boot [primary/backup]"

To download a new Image for the WLC, you can use either FTP or TFTP protocols,
and the command is: 

"transfer download start"

Here is an example:


(Cisco Controller) >transfer download datatype code
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download mode ftp
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download username admin
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download password ********
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download serverip 192.168.1.2
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download path /Shared/AIR-CT3504/
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download filename AIR-CT3504-K9-8-8-111-0.aes
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download start <<<<<

choices.D: DHCP Option 43 must be added to the neighboring switchport
choices.C: The 2504 controller must be added to the same mobility group as the 5508.
choices.B: UDP 5246 and TCP Protocol 97 must be enabled on the router
choices.A: UDP 16666 and IP Protocol 97 must be enabled on the 2504 controller

questions.question_text: An engineer wants to deploy a 2504 controller as the anchor controller for a guest WLAN that resides on a 5508 controller in a different mobility group. What configuration change must be applied to support this deployment strategy?

discussion.content: Two controllers will not build a CAPWAP tunnel between them if they are n different mobility groups.

questions.question_text: What are the characteristic of 2.4Ghz? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
It seems answer E is not correct / not valid.
According to old rules of the FCC (and Cisco Docs) maximum power is as follows:
OFDM: 30mW
CCK: 100mW

However the FCC rules have been updated since then.
Current rules show the maximum transmiw power for the 2.4ghz band is 1W (1000mW).

https://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?SID=8a15722bbf28508d72e2737f93f76892&mc=true&node=pt47.1.15&rgn=div5#se47.1.15_1247

Â§15.247 Operation within the bands 902-928 MHz, 2400-2483.5 MHz, and 5725-5850 MHz.
.......
(a) Operation under the provisions of this Section is limited to frequency hopping and digitally modulated intentional radiators that comply with the following provisions:
.......
(3) For systems using digital modulation in the 902-928 MHz, 2400-2483.5 MHz, and 5725-5850 MHz bands: 1 Watt.

questions.question_text: Which three governing bodies for Wireless? (Choose three)

discussion.content:
I think the answer is correct.
TELEC is a governing telecom provider in Japan.

A and B are correct.
I cannot find any information on the other 3 options being regulatory bodies.
Perhaps there is a typo here.

The final command is:
"transfer download start"

Steps to update the firmware of a WLC

(Cisco Controller) >transfer download datatype code
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download mode ftp
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download username admin
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download password ********
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download serverip 192.168.1.2
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download path /Shared/AIR-CT3504/
(Cisco Controller) >transfer download filename AIR-CT3504-K9-8-8-111-0.aes
